title: Ricki Lake and Olivia Olson become first acts voted off The X Factor: Celebrity
text:
Olivia Olson couldn’t believe it (Picture: ITV)

Ricki Lake and Olivia Olson have become the first acts voted off The X Factor: Celebrity.

During the first live show, Ricki performed the Fleetwood Mac hit Landslide but found herself in the bottom three with Olivia and Martin Bashir.

The public vote sent Ricki home, and she joked to Dermot O’Leary: ‘I guess I have to stick to my day job.’

But the judges then had to pick a second act to go home, and Simon Cowell had the deciding choice, picking Olivia to go home as he said he believed the public would rather see Martin for another week.

Olivia was left in floods of tears and couldn’t speak to Dermot.

Olivia was unable to speak to Dermot (Picture: ITV)

‘Hold it together, how you doing?’ asked Dermot, to which she replied: ‘Not great.’

‘With you, you know what, you have been embraced and I know you are going home but I have heard your stuff and you have some great original stuff, I’ve heard it out there on Spotify.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Use this as a springboard and we wish you all the very best of luck.’

Olivia Olson was left in tears (Picture: ITV)

Viewers at home couldn’t believe the decision though.

‘Olivia was the better singer,’ shared one fan which Martin agreed with.

‘I didn’t [expect to be saved],’ Martin told Dermot.

‘Olivia is a wonderful vocalist, ten times what I am so it’s tough. We knew coming into it would be hard.’

The show has been a hit with viewers, reinventing the tired format by bringing in celebrities without former music careers to sign a new deal with judge Simon Cowell.

The format also saw the audience sat on tables, similar to a jazz lounge layout, instead of the usual auditorium seats.

Ricki Lake was sent home by the public (Picture: Rex)

The Chase star Jenny Ryan was the first act to be awarded a safe chair after she made her way back onto the X Factor: Celebrity after being booted off the show last week.

Yes, despite being eliminated, the hopeful returned following an outpour of love for the star and a ‘Justice for Jenny Ryan’ campaign.

The 37-year-old impressed the judges with her performance of Conchita Wurst hit, Rise Like A Phoenix, smashing her vocals and securing herself a place in the next round.

After her performance, Nicole Scherzinger gushed: ‘Oh my gosh I don’t even know where to start with that, I am blown away. Right now I am speechless.’

She added: ‘That performance was ruthless and roofless because you just blew the roof off.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Louis Walsh handed his safe chair to Jonny Labey who performed a big band version of Show Me Love while Simon Cowell gave his chair Try Star.

Vinnie Jones also shocked fans with his performance, as he tackled an uplifting Blues Brothers classic in memory of his late wife.

The Love Island supergroup No Love Lost unexpectedly performed an original song and blew away the fans at home.

The full list of the songs being performed by The X Factor: Celebrity contestants GROUPS Try Star – Pony by Ginuwine / Old Town Road by Lil Nas X V5- Bad Guy by Billie Elish / Taki Taki by DJ Snake, Ozuna, Cardi B and Selena Gomez Max and Harvey – When Will I Be Famous by Bros No Love Lost – All Or Nothing (Original Song) OVERS Ricki Lake- Landslide by Fleetwood Mac Jenny Ryan – Rise Like A Phoenix by Conchita Wurst Victoria Ekanoye – Never Tear Us Apart by INXS Vinnie Jones – Everybody Needs Somebody by The Blues Brothers Martin Bashir– Danke Schoen by Wayne Newton. UNDERS Megan McKenna – This (Original Song) Olivia Olson – Anyone Who Had A Heart by Dionne Warwick Jonny Labey – Show Me Love by Robin S Kevin McHale – Good as Hell by Lizzo

The X Factor: Celebrity airs at 8.35pm on ITV.
